    • Method Detail

      • setAntiAliasingSupportEnabled

        public static void setAntiAliasingSupportEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables support for anti-aliasing. It overrides default settings for the lifetime of the process. This API should be called upon onCreate of the Application (before GL Configuration is initialized). This API is used when the device is having rendering issues such as partial map rendering or having parts of the screen corrupted. This is due to some chipset's inability to support anti-aliasing. By turning off anti-aliasing these issues will be resolved. In Android 4.x (and newer), anti-aliasing is, by default, enabled for all devices. When the renderer chipset is identified as one of the anti-aliasing unsupported chipset the feature will be automatically disabled. It will override any user settings if setAntiAliasingAllowed is called before rendering begins.

        In Android 2.3, anti-aliasing is, by default, disabled for all devices. When the renderer chipset is NOT identified as one of the anti-aliasing unsupported chipset the feature will be automatically enabled. It will NOT override user settings if setAntiAliasingAllowed is called before rendering begins. The changes will take effect after the next application restart.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true to turn on anti-aliasing, false otherwise

      • isAntiAliasingSupportEnabled

        public static boolean isAntiAliasingSupportEnabled()
        Gets the anti-aliasing settings.
        Returns:
        true if anti-aliasing is enabled, false otherwise

      • setIsolatedDiskCacheRootPath

        @Deprecated
public static boolean setIsolatedDiskCacheRootPath(@NonNull
                                                               java.lang.String path)
        Deprecated. As of SDK 3.16. Use MapSettings.setDiskCacheRootPath(String) instead.
        Method to allow switching of the disk cache path.

        The method must be called before the init() methods on MapEngine.

        Note, that starting from Android 11, disk cache path should be located under app-specific directory.

        Parameters:
        path - A string containing the new disk cache path.
        Returns:
        false if path matches default disk cache path or path is a file or invalid or is not writable, otherwise true.
        See Also:
        DiskCacheUtility
        Note:
        The disk cache path should NOT be set to a place where it can be easily removed or tampered with such as Android application cache folder. Instead, the disk cache path should be set to where files can be persistent., After the MapEngine is successfully initialized, removal or tampering of the disk cache path folder and its content is not supported and detrimental to the operation of the MapEngine while it is running., This method prevents sharing of the disk cache with other clients using the SDK., The behavior is undefined if the disk cache location is used by another application., DiskCacheUtility.migrate(String, String) could be called before MapEngine init for reusing disk cache.

      • setDiskCacheRootPath

        public static void setDiskCacheRootPath(@NonNull
                                        java.lang.String path)
        Switches default HERE SDK disk cache path. Default path for apps that have offline storage permission is Context.getExternalFilesDir(String), otherwise Context.getFilesDir().

        The method must be called before the init() methods on MapEngine.

        Note, that starting from Android 11, disk cache path should be located under app-specific directory.

        Parameters:
        path - A string containing the new disk cache path.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if provided path is not writable.
        Note:
        The disk cache path should NOT be set to a place where it can be easily removed or tampered with such as Android application cache folder. Instead, the disk cache path should be set to where files can be persistent., After the MapEngine is successfully initialized, removal or tampering of the disk cache path folder and its content is not supported and detrimental to the operation of the MapEngine while it is running., The behavior is undefined if the disk cache location is used by another application., DiskCacheUtility.migrate(String, String) could be called before MapEngine init for reusing disk cache.
